lines.text: I wish I knew what in God's name they were saying out there!

[bumps head, starts imitating Gambetti]
Professore! This little room is-a 15 inches-a wide! My little saw gonna come right-a down-a the middle! I hope ya like-a the color red! A-ha-ha-ha-haaaa! Aaa-ha-ha-haaa!
[normal voice]
I also read lips.
What did the letter say Mrs.Hill?
IT SAID I WANTED TO TOUCH HIS WINKLE!
Ohh...
His what?
Nevermind, i'll explain later.
Are you Mister S., for Sigerson, Holmes?
Perhaps.
Do you have a brother whose first name is Sherlock?
I do not.
You do have a brother?
I do.
Might I inquire as to his first name?
"Sheer luck."
You call this tea?
No, I call that hot water.
Jenny!
[singing]
Have you seen the latest dance that's come along?/Jenny, go and put your Sunday hat and jacket on/There's going to be some jollicky, come with me, happy-py, fill your heart with ecstasy/Jenny/
It's the greatest thing creation's ever known/
Take a little tip from me/Hold tight/
I'm all right/
When you do the/
H/
O/
P/
Come... on... and/

Hop/Hop/Come and do the kangaroo hop/Hop/That's the dance for me and you/If you're over 80, you can waltz a little while/But hopping about the parlor is the very latest style/Come on and hop/Hop/Hear the music goin' pop/You'll never, never want to stop/There's no other kind of dance at all/So come along, my honey, make the others look small/Come and do the kangaroo/If you know what's good for you/Come and do the kangaroo hop...
[singing]
Why don't we all drink/Some very sexy wine?
While Sherlock is gone, he will pass on one or two of his less urgent assignments to his brother, Sigerson.
[clock goes off]
Holmes! You never told me you had a brother, Sigerson.
I never told you I had a brother Mycroft... until the occasion arose.
Well, who is the fellow?
Sigerson is my younger brother. And he has spent the past thirty years getting hopelessly twisted in my shadow.
Extremely jealous, is he?
Mm, something of the sort.
Love and hate, eh?
I should say hate... and dislike.

[rushed, panicked singing]
The chicken was in peril/The princess was delicious...

[fearfully wailing a song]
Away, away, away, away, away, away, away...
What are you doing?
Whenever I'm petrified, I either cry or sing.
[continues]
London streets and places of all interest! Abbey Road! Abbey Street! Abigail Gardens! Abbington Road! Adelphi Terrace! Adelphi Theatre!...
Is this rotten or wonderfully brave?
You're too shit smart for your own good, boy.
I don't wish to talk about it.
The problem won't go away because you don't wish to t...
I don't wish to talk about it!
You're making a tragic mistake, love.
I've made a tragic mistake. More tragic than you can possibly imagine. And unless I am very careful... I am going to die for it.
Holmes, how will you ever repay him?
By playing the violin, Watson. By playing the violin.
"Rachedd." "Dechdar." "Drechad." "Chaderd" - hello, chaderd! Unless I'm very much mistaken, chaderd is the Egyptian word meaning "to eat fat." Now we're getting somewhere!
My name is Jenny Hill, and I'm simultaneously funny and sad.
How do you do? My name is Bessie Bellwood.
LIAR!
Oh! You don't fool around, do you? How do you know that I'm not Bessie Bellwood?

[singing]
There's no harm in taking a kiss/It's never missed...

[singing next line]
If I'd known that love was like this, should I have kissed?

[singing]
Love's a game if you are clever/Play your cards and go...

[singing next line]
Love with me will last forever/That is all I know - chorus! - But you don't love as I love...
All right, all right, enough!
[singing]
Piggy, piggy, piggy, piggy, piggy, piggy poo/Cried the farmer's daughter, Phyllis...

[hesitant singing]
Piggy, piggy, piggy, piggy, pig - Well, I don't think I know that one.
Pity! Next time you decide to impersonate a music hall singer who's been dead for the past twelve years, I suggest you learn her full repertoire! Won't you come in, MISS LIAR?
"Eduardo Gambetti"? The name strikes a bell. Ever heard of him, Sacker?

[slaps head; low voice]
"Oh, not Gambetti again!"
[high voice]
"'Fraid so, sir."
[low]
"Fat little fart, fancies himself as an opera singer."
[high]
"That's him, sir."
[low]
"Pour us some tea, will you, Sacker?"
[normal voice]
Yes, sir.
[low]
"How does he do it, Greerson?"
[high]
"Pays the highest prices for spicy letters, sir. Everything on the market goes to Gambetti."
[low]
"Oh, the swine."
[high]
"Swine he may be, sir, but he certainly is the cleverest of all the blackmailers."
[smiles]
I'm not sure... What just happened?
Never mind. I'll explain it to you later.

[Gambetti's just caught him trying to break a vase over his head]
You've got a lovely vase.
And *you* got a lovely face!
[first lines]
The Foreign Secretary, Lord Redcliff!

[rehearsing what to say under his breath]
Your Majesty, being inside of your confidence is the greatest joy I've ever known. Ahem...

[handing him the document]
Lord Redcliff, the fate of England is now in your hands.
Your Confidence... being inside of Your Majesty is the greatest single joy I've ever known.
[realizing what he's said, he tosses the document away]
Woof!
It's alright, Your Majesty! I've got it! I've got it. All's well that ends well!
Shit.
[Sigerson is trying to seduce her]
Would you like me to warm your pe - your tea?
I'm not proud of what I did!
You've just told me a magnificent success story! Overlooking the fact that you're a liar, a thief, a traitor, and a whore, I don't see what should be bothering you!

[singing]
Oh, what regret when love devours my heart? Ohhhhhhhhh...
[two gunshots]
Shit.
[singing]
Ohhhhhhhhhhhhh...
Father forgive me for I have sinned. I don't know why... but ever since I was a little boy... I've been struck with a compulsion to do something ABSOLUTELY ROTTEN every twenty minutes.
